intro: Mascagnia filipes, commonly known as the silky mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Mascagnia filipes is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
